description: Borrowed from Latin acēscēns, acēscentis, present participle of acēscēre (“to turn sour”), inchoative of acēre (“to be sour”): compare French acescent.

adjectives.description: acescent (comparative more acescent, superlative most acescent)

entries.meaning: Turning sour; readily becoming tart or acid; slightly sour.
examples: The fluid was a pale yellow , thick , creamy - looking substance , of uniform consistency . It had a disagreeable acescent odour, something resembling that of putrecsent milk.

entries.meaning: A substance liable to become sour.
